SEARCH
Package gw.api.heatmap

Class HeatMapCaches

java.lang.Object
gw.api.heatmap.HeatMapCaches
public class HeatMapCaches extends Object
Gives access to HeatMapCache instances, by type. A HeatMapCache is used to cache values that are expensive to load and so need to be shared between all users on a particular application server. The values are refreshed automatically at intervals though the intervals are typically fairly long (many minutes or even hours) because the expense of reloading is so high.

There are a small set of heat map caches per server and they are organized by type, one cache of each type. So, for example, there might be one cache of type ACache for caching objects of type A and another of type BCache for caching a objects of type B. getCacheWithType(java.lang.Class) can be used to get a particular cache e.g. HeatMapCaches.getCacheWithType(ACache) (or ACache.class if called from Java)

See Also:

  • Method Details

    • getCacheWithType

      public static <T extends HeatMapCache> T getCacheWithType(Class<T> cacheClass)
      Return the HeatMapCache with the given class. There is only one instance of a particular heat map cache class and the set of available classes is determined by the IHeatMapCachePlugin, which is called to create the caches at server startup.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the generic type parameter for the type of the desired cache
      Parameters:
      cacheClass - the type of the desired cache
      Returns:
      the HeatMapCache instance with the given type
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the given class does not have any associated instance
